014package org.microbean.assign;
015
016import java.util.Comparator;
017
018import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
019
020/**
021 * A {@link Comparator} establishing a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Partially_ordered_set"><dfn>partial
022 * order</dfn></a> over {@link TypeKind}s such that {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type variables} precede {@linkplain
023 * TypeKind#isPrimitive primitive types}, {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive primitive types} precede {@linkplain
024 * TypeKind#ARRAY array types}, and {@linkplain TypeKind#ARRAY array types} precede {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED
025 * declared types}.
026 *
027 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
028 *
029 * @see #compare(TypeKind, TypeKind)
030 */
031public final class PrimitiveAndReferenceTypeKindComparator implements Comparator<TypeKind> {
032
033
034  /*
035   * Static fields.
036   */
037
038
039  /**
040   * The sole instance of this class.
041   */
042  public static final PrimitiveAndReferenceTypeKindComparator INSTANCE = new PrimitiveAndReferenceTypeKindComparator();
043
044
045  /*
046   * Constructors.
047   */
048
049
050  private PrimitiveAndReferenceTypeKindComparator() {
051    super();
052  }
053
054
055  /*
056   * Instance methods.
057   */
058
059
060  /**
061   * Compares the two {@link TypeKind}s and returns the result.
062   *
063   * <p>If {@code k0} is {@code null} and {@code k1} is not, returns a positive value.</p>
064   *
065   * <p>If {@code k1} is {@code null} and {@code k0} is not, returns a negative value.</p>
066   *
067   * <p>If {@code k0} is {@link TypeKind#ARRAY}, and {@code k1} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive},
068   * returns a positive value.</p>
069   *
070   * <p>If {@code k0} is {@link TypeKind#ARRAY}, and {@code k1} is {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, returns a negative
071   * value.</p>
072   *
073   * <p>If {@code k0} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}, and {@code k1} is {@link TypeKind#ARRAY} or
074   * {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, returns a negative value.</p>
075   *
076   * <p>If {@code k0} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}, and {@code k1} is {@link TypeKind#TYPEVAR},
077   * returns a positive value.</p>
078   *
079   * <p>If {@code k0} is {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, and {@code k1} is {@link TypeKind#ARRAY}, or {@linkplain
080   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}, or is {@link TypeKind#TYPEVAR}, returns a positive value.</p>
081   *
082   * <p>If {@code k0} is {@link TypeKind#TYPEVAR}, and {@code k1} is {@link TypeKind#ARRAY}, or {@linkplain
083   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}, or is {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, returns a negative value.</p>
084   *
085   * <p>Returns {@code 0} in all other cases.
086   *
087   * @param k0 a {@link TypeKind}; may be {@code null}
088   *
089   * @param k1 a {@link TypeKind}; may be {@code null}
090   *
091   * @return a comparison result
092   *
093   * @see TypeKind#isPrimitive()
094   *
095   * @see TypeKind#ARRAY
096   *
097   * @see TypeKind#DECLARED
098   *
099   * @see TypeKind#TYPEVAR
100   */
101  @Override // Comparator<TypeKind>
102  public final int compare(final TypeKind k0, final TypeKind k1) {
103    return k0 == k1 ? 0 : k0 == null ? 1 : k1 == null ? -1 : switch (k0) {
104
105    case ARRAY -> switch (k1) {
106    // Arrays come after primitives and type variables.
107    case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT, TYPEVAR -> 1;
108    // Arrays come before declared types.
109    case DECLARED -> -1; // arrays come before declared
110    default -> 0;
111    };
112
113    case BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> switch (k1) {
114    // Primitives come before arrays and declared types.
115    case ARRAY, DECLARED -> -1;
116    // Primitives come after type variables.
117    case TYPEVAR -> 1;
118    default -> 0;
119    };
120
121    case DECLARED -> switch (k1) {
122    // Declared types come after arrays, primitives and type variables.
123    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT, TYPEVAR -> 1;
124    default -> 0;
125    };
126
127    case TYPEVAR -> switch (k1) {
128      // Type variables come before arrays, primitives and declared types.
129    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DECLARED, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> -1;
130    default -> 0;
131    };
132
133    default -> 0;
134    };
135  }
136
137}
